title: UFC moving to Paramount with 7-year, $7.7B deal
content: Paramount will become the new home to all Ultimate Fighting Championship events in the U.S. under a seven-year, $7.7 billion agreement with TKO Group.

title: Eagles' Dickerson injured in practice, exits on cart
content: Eagles Pro Bowl left guard Landon Dickerson was helped off the field and carted indoors after suffering an apparent right leg injury during the team's open practice Sunday night.

title: Aces' Wilson first with 30-point, 20-rebound game
content: A'ja Wilson had 32 points and 20 rebounds, becoming the first player in WNBA history with 30-plus points and at least 20 rebounds in a game.

title: Rose rallies late, tops Spaun in St. Jude playoff
content: Justin Rose made up a three-shot deficit over the last five holes against hard-luck Tommy Fleetwood, and then made two birdies in a playoff against U.S. Open champion J.J. Spaun to win the FedEx St. Jude Championship on Sunday.

title: Raleigh clubs MLB-best 45th HR in Mariners' win
content: Cal Raleigh hit his major-league-leading 45th home run in a four-run first inning, and Seattle hung on for a 6-3 victory over Tampa Bay on Sunday.

title: Bills delivers Pennsylvania first LLSWS since '78
content: Behind Reagan Bills' two-way heroics, Johnstown, Pennsylvania, defeated Floyds Knobs, Indiana, 1-0 on Sunday to win the state's first Little League Softball World Series since 1978.

title: Olympian Rivera, 17, wins at U.S. championships
content: Hezly Rivera, a 17-year-old Olympic gold medalist, pulled away for a victory at the U.S. gymnastics championships Sunday.

title: With Messi out, Orlando drops Miami to 6th in rout
content: Luis Muriel scored a goal in each half and Mart√≠n Ojeda had a goal and an assist to lead Orlando City to a 4-1 victory over Inter Miami on Sunday night.

title: MLB playoff contender tiers: The locks, teams with work to do and the long shots
content: As hot streaks and cold spells jumble the postseason picture, here's how sure we are that your team will be playing in October.

title: Online predators prey on young athletes using sextortion
content: A Michigan teen was goaded into sharing an intimate photo that scammers threatened to expose unless he paid up.

title: ESPN's preseason All-America team: The best at every position
content: With the 2025 season right around the corner, we break down the top players, from quarterback to kick returner.

title: Orlovsky ranks the best NFL QBs in seven different traits: Who makes each top-10 list?
content: Which NFL quarterbacks have the strongest arms, greatest accuracy and best rushing ability? Dan Orlovsky stacked the 10 best in seven skill areas.

title: Where the NBA's biggest remaining free agents stand this offseason
content: The futures of Jonathan Kuminga, Josh Giddey and others remain in flux as the 2025-26 season draws closer.

title: The bloody life of a UFC Octagon
content: Since the UFC's birth in 1993, fighters, coaches and executives have come and gone. The one character that has never changed? The Octagon.

title: Matthew and Brady Tkachuk on Olympic gold, Canada rivalry and new NHL CBA
content: What's it like being on the cover of a video game with their dad? And what are their thoughts on the Winter Games?

title: Ranked: The top 50 players going into the new Premier League seasonÔªø
content: Ahead of the 2025-26 Premier League season, let's rank the best 50 players to keep an eye on. Liverpool and Arsenal dominate the list, but Man United managed some spots, too.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Donnarumma available for low transfer fee
content: Paris Saint-Germain have made goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma available for a knockdown transfer fee. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: üèà Ranking all 136 FBS teams ahead of the season
content: From Tier 1 to Tier 20, David Hale ranks all 136 college football program into tiers ahead of the 2025 season.

title: üèÜ Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: üèÄ Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: üèà ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: üßÇ 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: üëä Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Remarks On Leadership, Vote Theft: Inside Karnataka Minister's Ouster
content: Karnataka Cooperation Minister KN Rajanna, who was considered a loyalist of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, was asked to resign today.

title: Karnataka Minister Ousted After Voter List Remarks Upset Party, BJP Jeers
content: Karnataka Minister KN Rajanna was ousted by the Congress - Rahul Gandhi wanted him out and there could be further action against him, sources have said.

title: PETA's Sharp Reaction After Supreme Court's 'Remove All Stray Dogs' Order
content: The Supreme Court's sweeping order to remove all stray dogs from Delhi and the adjoining National Capital Region (NCR) has drawn a response from animal rights groups, with PETA warning that large-scale displacement is "unscientific".

title: India "Losing Trust" In Partnership With US: Amitabh Kant On Tariff Move
content: The trust built up between India and the US for over two decades is bound to b pulled down by the pejorative comments and tariff moves of US President of Donald Trump, former Niti Aayog chief and G20 Sherpa said today.

title: Drunk EasyJet Pilot Roams Naked In African Hotel's Reception, Gym, Spa
content: An EasyJet pilot was suspended after he was allegedly found drunk and naked at a luxury hotel in Africa.

title: Woman Strangles 5-Month-Old Baby Over Affair In Tripura, Arrested: Cops
content: A woman has been arrested for allegedly strangling her five-month-old daughter in Tripura's Sepahijala district, officials said Monday, making it the second such incident in the state in the last few days.

title: Trump Tariffs To Impact 55% Of Total Merchandise Exports To US: Minister
content: About 55 per cent of India's total merchandise exports to the US will be subject to 25 per cent reciprocal tariff, Minister of State for Finance Ministry Pankaj Chaudhary said on Monday.

title: Pakistan Lost Rs 4.1 Billion After Airspace Ban On Indian Flights: Report
content: Pakistan's airport body suffered a loss of Rs 4.1 billion in over two months due to the closure of airspace for Indian airlines, according to official data.

title: Dentist Kills Mother-In-Law, Chops Body Into 19 Pieces In Karnataka: Cops
content: Police cracked Lakshmi Devi murder case in Koratagere in Tumakuru and arrested her dentist son-in-law Dr Ramachandrappa S and his two accomplices.

title: Video: Elephant Startled By Tourist's Camera Flash, Chases And Tramples Him
content: In a video shared on Instagram, the elephant is seen standing on a road crowded with vehicles and people.

title: Shimla Boarding School Alumnus Kidnapped 3 Students For Extortion: Cops
content: A Bishop Cotton School (BCS) alumnus was arrested for allegedly kidnapping three school students from his alma mater for an extortion bid, police said on Monday.

title: Actor Rana Daggubati Appears Before Probe Agency In Betting App Case With 5 Years' Bank Details
content: Armed with a blue file that held bank statements for five years, actor Rana Daggubati appeared before the Enforcement Directorate's Hyderabad office in connection with the alleged online betting games promotion case Monday.

title: Video: Leopard Cub's Car Ride After Rescue In Himachal Pradesh
content: A leopard cub, around 25 days old, was rescued by a local in Himachal Pradesh. The man found the animal abandoned and vulnerable by the roadside.

title: Kapil Sharma's Security Increased In Mumbai After Attack On Canada Cafe
content: Actor-comedian Kapil Sharma's security has been increased by Mumbai Police, days after a threat from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang over his ties with Salman Khan.

title: Adani Defence, Prime Aero To Acquire 100% Stake In Indamer Technics
content: Adani Defence Systems and Technologies Limited (ADSTL), in partnership with Prime Aero, on Monday signed a binding agreement to acquire a 100 per cent stake in Indamer Technics Private Limited (ITPL).

title: "Streets Must Be Safe": P Chidambaram Backs Top Court's Stray Dogs Order
content: Veteran Congress leader and Rajya Sabha MP P Chidambaram has welcomed the Supreme Court's tough order to check the stray dog menace in Delhi-NCR and said the directions need to be implemented in every city across the country.

title: France's Last Newspaper Hawker To Receive Nation's Top Honour From President Macron
content: France will honour the country's last newspaper hawker, Ali Akbar, with the National Order of Merit for his decades-long service of delivering newspapers to cafes and restaurants in Paris' fashionable Latin Quarter.

title: Air India To Suspend Delhi-Washington Flights From September 1
content: Air India has announced that it is halting its services between Delhi and Washington, DC, from next month due to a combination of "operational factors".

title: Rajasthan Man Kills Wife, Tells Cops She Was Attacked By Robbers: Police
content: A man was detained for allegedly killing his wife in Rajasthan's Kishangarh after he reported to police that she was attacked by robbers, officials said Monday.

title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy dials PM Modi, raises issue of oil trade with Russia
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy conveyed to PM Modi about the ongoing Russian invasion, highlighting attacks on Ukrainian cities, including the recent shelling in Zaporizhzhia. Zelenskyy urged India to support peaceful efforts and emphasized that decisions about Ukraine must involve Ukraine's participation. Discussions also covered sanctions against Russia, particularly restricting energy exports.

title: 'Have made it clear ... ': India flags Pak army chief's nuclear threat from US soil
content: India has strongly criticized Pakistan, labeling it an irresponsible nuclear state controlled by its military, following Pak General Asim Munir's threatening remarks. Munir warned of destroying Indian infrastructure affecting water flow and issued a broader nuclear threat. India asserts Pakistan's military dominance undermines democracy and raises concerns about nuclear weapons falling into the wrong hands.

title: 'Vote theft' row splits K'taka Cong: Minister contradicts Rahul; asked to quit
content: Karnataka Minister KN Rajanna criticized his own Congress party for neglecting alleged electoral roll irregularities during their governance, expressing shame over the oversights. Deputy CM DK Shivakumar rebuked Rajanna, disagreeing with his assessment, while speculation arose about Rajanna's potential resignation following his dissenting remarks on vote theft, prompting a meeting with the CM.

title: Trump tariffs: Can Indian refiners do without Russian oil?
content: Kpler reports Indian refiners possess the technical capacity to operate without Russian crude, but this shift would entail significant economic and strategic disadvantages. Replacing Russian oil, which constitutes a substantial portion of India's refinery intake, would elevate feedstock costs and freight charges. This transition would also misalign product yields, making it a commercially challenging endeavor.

title: 'Gill captaining in Duleep Trophy is a massive ... ': Gavaskar
content: Fresh from a stellar Test series against England, Shubman Gill is set to captain North Zone in the upcoming Duleep Trophy. Sunil Gavaskar lauded both the BCCI's decision to prioritise domestic cricket and Gill's commitment to participate. Gill's presence is a significant boost for the tournament, setting a positive example for his teammates.

title: Microsoft CEO to employees: No longer enough to be software factory, must become‚Ä¶
content: Microsoft is undergoing a significant shift, transitioning from a software manufacturer to an "intelligence engine," according to CEO Satya Nadella. This transformation aims to democratize AI, empowering global users to create their own intelligent tools. Microsoft will focus on building AI systems that enable individuals and organizations to develop customized solutions, redesigning its technology stack to support this new vision.

title: Exclusive | Watching Carlsen at 2: How 5-yo Aarini became India No. 1 youngest talent
content: At just five, Delhi‚Äôs Aarini Lahoty is India‚Äôs highest-rated chess player in her age group, boasting a FIDE rating of 1551. Introduced to the game by her father-coach Surendar, Aarini began playing as a toddler and now competes in higher age categories. Balancing studies, chess, and play, she dreams of becoming India‚Äôs youngest IM and GM.

title: Rohit Sharma's new Lamborghini car has the number 3015 - Here's why
content: Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma has acquired a striking red Lamborghini Urus SE in Mumbai, featuring a personalized '3015' number plate. This number cleverly combines his children's birthdays and links to his iconic jersey number, 45. The high-performance Urus SE, priced at Rs 4.57 crore, boasts impressive speed and power.

title: ‚ÄòScared‚Äô of Mark Zuckerberg offers, Sam Altman gives special bonus: Million dollars in cash or...
content: OpenAI is awarding millions in bonuses to roughly one-third of its employees, primarily researchers and engineers, to combat aggressive poaching attempts from rivals like Meta and xAI. These "special one-time" bonuses, distributed quarterly over two years, aim to retain top AI talent amidst intense competition, with some researchers potentially receiving payouts in the mid-single-digit millions.

title: Delhi: 2 of 6 tiger cubs born last week in zoo die; 4 under close watch
content: Tragedy struck the Delhi Zoo. Two Bengal tiger cubs died within three days. This happened after a litter of six cubs was born. The mother, Aditi, is caring for the remaining four cubs. Zoo officials are monitoring them closely. Supplements are being given to Aditi. The zoo has a history of tiger breeding.

title: CBSE revamps Legal Studies: Students to study triple talaq, Sec 377 & sedition law removal from 2026
content: The CBSE will revise its Legal Studies syllabus for Classes XI and XII to include key legal reforms such as the repeal of triple talaq, the sedition law, and Section 377. The updated curriculum will align with the Bhartiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), Bhartiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS), and Bhartiya Sakshya Adhiniyam (BSA), replacing colonial-era laws. Implementation is scheduled for the 2026‚Äì27 academic session, with updated textbooks to be developed by an expert committee.

title: Air India to suspend nonstop Delhi-Washington flights from Sept 1
content: Air India will suspend its Delhi-Washington nonstop flights from September 1, 2025. This is due to a shortage of wide-body planes. The airline is revamping its legacy fleet. Passengers can rebook or get full refunds. The retrofit program aims to enhance customer experience. Supply chain issues have delayed the completion to October 2028.

title: Starbucks to customers in its third-largest market: Don't bring these gadgets to our stores
content: Ganesh Venkataramanan, previously with Tesla's Dojo, has launched DensityAI. The startup aims to transform self-driving car AI development. DensityAI focuses on a full-stack AI platform for autonomous vehicles. It addresses computational and data demands. The company seeks to streamline AI training and deployment for automakers. DensityAI plans to expand into robotics.

title: 'Rohit itna marega na tereko': Yuvraj warns content creator - Watch
content: Yuvraj Singh jokingly warns a content creator who mimics Rohit Sharma. The mimic is popular for his impressions. Rohit Sharma recently bought a Lamborghini Urus SE. The car has a personalized number plate. It reflects his children's birthdays and jersey number. Rohit last played in IPL 2025. India's ODI series against Bangladesh is cancelled. His next challenge is in Australia.

title: 'Baaghi 4' teaser out: Tiger Shroff hunts Sanjay Dutt amid blood and chaos - watch
content: 'Baaghi 4' teaser showcases Tiger Shroff as Ronny, facing off against Sanjay Dutt‚Äôs villain. The intense teaser features brutal action, including fierce female combat. It draws comparisons to Animal and Marco. Written by Sajid Nadiadwala and directed by A. Harsha, the film releases September 5.

title: Wayne Gretzky‚Äôs daughter: Unexpected role in Dustin Johnson‚ÄìBrooks Koepka feud rumours
content: The 2018 Ryder Cup witnessed intense competition. A rumour about Dustin Johnson and Brooks Koepka's alleged feud surfaced. Reports hinted at tension during the flight to Paris. Brooks Koepka denied the fight. He maintained a strong friendship with Johnson. The incident highlights the impact of media pressure on team chemistry. The event shows how narratives can overshadow performance.

title: Mahomes gets family, brother Jackson‚Äôs support after preseason benching
content: Patrick Mahomes, despite limited playtime in the preseason game against the Cardinals, demonstrated his readiness and leadership. After a brief appearance that included a touchdown pass, Mahomes shifted to a supportive role, advising teammates and offering insights to the coaching staff. Coach Reid praised Mahomes' leadership, emphasizing his importance to the team's Super Bowl aspirations.

title: Tyreek Hill, ex Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Taylor Swift on going public with Travis Kelce: 'Proud of each other'
content: Taylor Swift openly embraced her relationship with Travis Kelce, contrasting sharply with her past privacy, particularly with Joe Alwyn. Swift explained to TIME that they proudly support each other, dismissing the need to hide their romance. Since 2023, they've been publicly affectionate, attending events and date nights, fueling engagement speculations.

title: New I-T Bill passes Lok Sabha: What are top suggestions being included?
content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman  tabled the revised New Income Tax Bill 2025 in Parliament. This followed the withdrawal of the original bill. The new version incorporates recommendations from a Parliamentary Select Committee.

title: Kapil Sharma reveals Shilpa Shetty asks Govinda, ‚ÄòIf Sunita wasn‚Äôt around, then who shot you?‚Äô
content: The Raksha Bandhan episode of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' was a laughter-filled event featuring celebrity siblings. Kapil Sharma reminded Shilpa Shetty about a humorous question she posed to Govinda after his accidental shooting. Govinda recounted Shilpa's visit, where she inquired about the shooter's identity in Sunita's absence.

title: 'Liberation Day in DC': Trump declares he will end violence in US Capital
content: President Trump declared a "liberation day" for Washington, D.C., vowing to eliminate crime and filth while promising to restore the capital to its former glory. He announced a "crime and beautification" plan, increasing federal patrols and criticizing wasteful spending on projects like the Federal Reserve renovation.

title: Move over Dhoni! Ex-India captain declares who is World No. 1
content: Mohammad Azharuddin praised Syed Kirmani as the world's best wicketkeeper, highlighting his skills against spin and contribution to India's 1983 World Cup victory, at the launch of Kirmani's autobiography. Azharuddin also commended Mohammad Siraj for his outstanding performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy against England, where he emerged as the leading wicket-taker.

title: Magic Johnson & Wife Cookie share heartfelt moment honouring Lakers legend‚Äôs mother
content: Magic Johnson celebrated his mother, Christine Johnson's, 90th birthday with a heartfelt party alongside his wife, Cookie, and their children. The event, filled with love and appreciation, honored Christine's life dedicated to the Lord. Gospel artist Tamela Mann surprised Christine with a performance, making the celebration even more special at Breslin Arena.

title: 'Blue Peter' icon Biddy Baxter passes away at 92
content: Biddy Baxter, iconic Blue Peter editor, passed away at 92. She shaped the show for over 25 years, introducing the Blue Peter badge and charity drives. Praised as a trailblazer in children‚Äôs TV, she earned an MBE, BAFTA Children‚Äôs Special Award, and the Royal Television Society‚Äôs Baird Medal.

title: Musk‚Äôs breakup trail from friends to relationships: How he messed up with everyone
content: Elon Musk, celebrated for his tech innovations, is also known for strained relationships. From a fallout with Google's Larry Page over AI to a public spat with gamer Asmongold, Musk's ambition often leads to broken ties. Conflicts with Tesla co-founder Martin Eberhard, OpenAI's Sam Altman, and Twitter's Jack Dorsey highlight differing visions.

title: J&K: BSF troops shoot and injure ‚ÄòPakistani intruder' in Kathua district
content: Border Security Force (BSF) troops shot and injured a Pakistani intruder along the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district on Monday. The intruder was part of a group attempting to infiltrate Indian territory near the Hiranagar sector. Alert BSF personnel noticed the group and issued repeated warnings, which were ignored, leading to the firing.

title: Bloating is not normal: How enzyme-based supplements can help reduce water retention
content: Feeling bloated after meals is a common issue, often dismissed as normal, but it signals digestive overload. This occurs when food isn't fully broken down, leading to fermentation and gas. Enzyme-based supplements can aid digestion by breaking down complex foods, improving nutrient absorption, and supporting gut balance, ultimately preventing bloating and promoting overall digestive health.

title: Pigeon feeding row: Jain monk says 'will take up arms if needed'
content: Jain monk Muni Nileshchandra Vijay is threatening a hunger strike starting August 13 over the closure of Dadar Kabutarkhana, a traditional pigeon-feeding site. The BMC closed the area citing health concerns, leading to clashes. Vijay alleges political motivation and vows defiance, even against court orders, claiming widespread Jain support.

title: Alex Ovechkin speaks out: Why he won't join NHL with son Sergei
content: Alex Ovechkin, the NHL's top goal scorer, has dismissed the possibility of playing professionally with his son, Sergei, despite the six-year-old's impressive performance at a recent event in Moscow. Ovechkin humorously noted his age would prevent such a pairing. While a father-son NHL duo won't happen, Ovechkin's sons are showing hockey talent, potentially continuing the family's legacy in the sport.

title: 'Want answers, not attacks': Tharoor backs Rahul's 'vote theft' claims; joins INDIA bloc protest
content: Shashi Tharoor criticised the Election Commission for allegedly attacking Rahul Gandhi instead of addressing serious concerns about electoral integrity. Tharoor emphasised that the EC should prioritise clearing doubts about potential voter list manipulation and vote theft, rather than focusing on procedural formalities like demanding an oath or affidavit from Rahul Gandhi.

title: Watch: Chinese vessels collide on South China Sea while chasing boat
content: Tensions escalate in the South China Sea as a Chinese navy vessel collides with a Chinese coast guard ship during a chase of a Philippine patrol boat near Scarborough Shoal. The Philippine coast guard released video footage of the incident, which occurred during a humanitarian mission. Philippine President Marcos affirmed continued presence in the area to assert Manila's sovereign rights.

title: 'Global Sumud Flotilla': Greta Thunberg plans second Gaza aid voyage
content: Greta Thunberg announced a second, larger flotilla mission to deliver aid to Gaza, launching from Spain on August 31st with activists from 44 countries. The "Global Sumud Flotilla" includes multiple ships and aims to break the Israeli blockade, despite previous attempts being intercepted.

title: Fans defend Halle Berry after David Justice says he left because she "didn't cook or clean"
content: Halle Berry's fans are defending her after ex-husband David Justice's recent interview, where he claimed he left their marriage due to her not fitting his traditional expectations of a wife. Justice stated he desired a partner who cooked, cleaned, and embodied a strong maternal role, suggesting counseling might have altered their outcome.

title: LS passes sports bill; Mandaviya calls it biggest sports reform since Independence
content: India's sports sector is set for a major overhaul with the passage of the National Sports Governance Bill and the National Anti-Doping (Amendment) Bill. Sports Minister Mandaviya hailed the governance bill as the most significant reform since independence, aiming for accountability and transparency in sports federations. The anti-doping bill addresses WADA's concerns, ensuring NADA's independence.

title: Kapil Sharma gets tight security from Mumbai Police after firing at his caf√© in Canada
content: Following two shooting incidents outside Kapil Sharma's Canada caf√©, Mumbai Police have heightened security for the comedian and his family. The increased protection comes after Salman Khan's appearance on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show,' reportedly drawing the ire of the Lawrence Bishnoi syndicate.

title: Oppn MPs‚Äô march to EC: Akhilesh jumps barricade; Rahul detained ‚Äì Key points
content: Opposition leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, marched to the Election Commission to protest alleged voter fraud and irregularities in Bihar's electoral roll revision. Delhi Police halted the march, leading to dramatic scenes of leaders climbing barricades.

title: Bite marks, beatings: Nanny who brutalised toddler had no training
content: In Noida, a 15-month-old baby was allegedly tortured at a daycare center by a 16-year-old attendant, who bit her thighs and inflicted other injuries. The parents discovered the abuse after noticing bite marks and viewing CCTV footage that revealed the extent of the violence.

title: Russell Wilson‚Äôs wife: 1st descendant of enslaved Africans to gain Benin citizenship
content: Ciara, the Grammy-winning singer, has made history by becoming one of the first to receive Beninese citizenship through a program aimed at reconnecting descendants of enslaved Africans. This initiative seeks to heal historical wounds and strengthen ties with the Black diaspora. Benin's efforts carry significant weight due to its role in the transatlantic slave trade.

title: Justin Rose makes history, becomes PGA Tour‚Äôs oldest European winner
content: Justin Rose, at 45, defied age-related expectations with a remarkable comeback at the St. Jude Championship, securing victory in a tense playoff. His stellar performance, including six back-nine birdies, not only marked him as the PGA Tour's oldest European winner in the modern era but also propelled him up the FedEx Cup standings.

title: Nasa engineer unveils Taylor Swift's billion-dollar secret to success
content: Taylor Swift's ascent to global superstardom is attributed to strategic empire-building beyond music, as analyzed by a NASA engineer. Swift has cultivated a loyal fanbase through immersive experiences and reclaimed ownership of her music, disrupting industry norms. Her relentless work ethic and strategic decisions have propelled her into a powerful figure, offering a blueprint for success in any field.

title: Independence Day '25: Is it India's 78th or 79th Independence Day? All you need to know
content: India gears up to celebrate its 79th Independence Day in 2025, commemorating the nation's freedom from British rule. The celebrations will include flag hoisting, patriotic songs, and events promoting national unity, especially among the youth. The Prime Minister's address at the Red Fort will follow traditional protocols, honoring the sacrifices of freedom fighters and celebrating India's heritage.

title: Amid speculation over India future, here‚Äôs when Kohli last played a List A match
content: Speculation surrounds Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's ODI futures as the BCCI contemplates their roles. With the Bangladesh series canceled, their next potential ODI appearance is against Australia in October. A proposal suggests they gain match practice in India A games against Australia A before the series, raising questions about their readiness and future in the format.

title: 'Ensures representation': MHA defends LG's nominations to J&K assembly; submits affidavit to HC
content: The Home Ministry defended the LG's power to nominate assembly members in J&K, citing inclusivity. This came in response to a Congress leader's challenge to the Reorganisation Act. The ministry argued the nominations ensure representation for displaced communities and women. Mehbooba Mufti criticised the move as undemocratic, urging opposition to this precedent.

title: Teachers, schools won‚Äôt be penalised for poor results, says Karnataka Minister
content: Minister for School Education and Literacy Madhu Bangarappa on Monday promised to take back an order that penalises teachers and aided school management over low grades attained by students in SSLC

title: Local body polls: with one day to go for revised deadline to end, State Election Commission receives over 27 lakh applications for inclusion of names
content: Though SEC had set August 7 as deadline for enrolment applications and filing complaints, it extended the date to August 12. During this period, the commission received 4.60 lakh applications

title: A.P. will bring comprehensive film policy, Minister tells delegation of producers
content: Durgesh assures them of arranging a meeting with CM and Dy. CM in September to discuss industry problems

title: YSRCP accuses coalition govt. of electoral malpractices in Pulivendula and Ontimitta ZPTC byelections
content: The party leaders allege rampant voter intimidation, cash distribution, and administrative misuse, urging the State Election Commission to intervene for free and fair polls

title: ED files supplementary prosecution complaint against 56 accused in Amtek Auto ‚Äòbank loan fraud‚Äô case
content: Taking cognisance of the complaint, a special Delhi court has issued notice to all the accused, including promoters of the Amtek Group, their family members, Chartered Accountants, bankers, resolution professionals, and stock market operators

title: Children to be given eggs in school mid-day meal with written consent of parents
content: The State government will seek the consent of parents before providing schoolchildren eggs as part of the midday meal, Minister for School Education and Literacy Madhu Bangarappa said

title: SC to hear challenge to talaq-e-hasan from November 19
content: Talaq-e-hasan is a form of divorce among Muslims by which a man can dissolve marriage by pronouncing talaq once every month over a three-month period

title: Civil aviation minister says 10 emergency landings of planes due to tech snags reported since January 2024
content: Minister of State for Civil Aviation provides updates on audits, incidents, and safety measures in aviation industry

title: Draft policy for the elderly proposes ‚ÄòKerala model of ageing‚Äô
content: Envisages vital role for local governments in fostering community-driven care models.  The government will promote ageing in place by strengthening home and community-based care systems

title: Committee formed to regulate film ticket fare, Kerala govt. tells HC
content: Division Bench was hearing a public interest litigation demanding that a limit be fixed on the maximum fare that can be levied by cinemas and multiplex theatres

title: AI-based complaint registration has instilled confidence in public, say Eluru police
content: Public can lodge their complaints through https://meekosam.ap.gov.in from home and know its status by dialling 1100

title: Walk for Nation with giant tricolour on Independence Day in Hubballi
content: This time, Uday Bharat Yuvak Mandal will try to set a record by carrying a 2,000 ft long flag during the celebrations

title: Karnataka govt. serious about moving ineligible people from BPL families to APL category: Muniyappa
content: The State government is serious about shifting families that are ineligible to receive the Below Poverty Line (BPL) card benefits to the Above Poverty Line (APL) category, Food and Civil Supplies Minister K.H. Muniyappa said on Monday.

title: Naidu for Logistics Corporation to coordinate cargo transport, 20 new ports in A.P.
content: Chief Minister unveils plans to develop ports, airports, and MSME parks across State into economic hubs surrounded by satellite townships linked to strong transport networks

title: K.N. Rajanna, known for sparking controversies, finally exits Cabinet
content: The high command‚Äôs direction to sack Mr. Rajanna from the Cabinet is also seen as a stern message to the Chief Minister‚Äôs loyalists to adhere to the party‚Äôs discipline

title: Concern expressed over free trade agreements pursued by Central government
content: Framers‚Äô and workers‚Äô unions to hold nationwide ‚ÄòQuit Corporates‚Äô protest on August 13 to voice opposition against the agreements

title: PM Modi speaks to Ukraine President Zelenskyy, asserts need for early resolution of conflict
content: In an X post on the conversation, Mr. Zelenskyy said that it was necessary to ‚Äúlimit the export of Russian energy‚Äù, particularly oil; he said they agreed to plan a personal meeting in September at the U.N. and to work on an exchange of visits.

title: BJP stages protest condemning Congress govt. diverting funds meant for SCs, STs for guarantee schemes
content: They take out a protest march and submit a memorandum to the Deputy Commissioner‚Äôs office addressed to Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot

title: CAT Ernakulam Bench vacates stay on transfer of ED official
content: Bench dismisses plea by P. Radhakrishnan, Deputy Director of ED, against his transfer from Kochi to ED zonal office in Srinagar

title: Climate tech startup Sow&Reap Agro bags carbon credits for sustainable paddy crop
content: Certification from global body Gold Standard is for the Hyderabad firm‚Äôs project promoting AWD to cut methane emissions from paddy cultivation in Telangana¬†

title: Parliamentary panel pulls up Rural Development Ministry for evasive replies on MGNREGS
content: The committee had sought clarification from the government on the pending dues and the low budgetary allocation under the programme

title: Steps will be taken to develop large-scale storage facilities in Rayalaseema region, says Minister
content: The government is committed to protecting farmers‚Äô interests by curbing middlemen exploitation and ensuring fair prices for their produce: Nadendla Manohar

title: A.P. govt. issues order providing free bus travel for women in State from August 15
content: Named Stree Shakti, the scheme will be available for all girls, women and transgender persons in State in five categories of APSRTC bus services

title: Congress condemns Asim Munir's remarks, says U.S. giving him special treatment is bizarre
content: In an address to the Pakistani diaspora in Florida's Tampa, Asim Munir reportedly made the nuclear threat in case his country faced an existential threat in a future war with India.

title: Iconic boat jetty at Vaikom set to get a major facelift after years of neglect
content: Restoration project under way for historic Vaikom boat jetty visited by Mahatma Gandhi, preserving heritage structure for future generations.

title: In the run-up to Onam, Kerala seeks nod for ‚Çπ6,000 cr. additional borrowing, restoration of deducted sums
content: Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal meets Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in New Delhi .  Further, he urges the Centre to restore ‚Çπ3,323 crore clipped from its borrowing ceiling in the name of the Guarantee Redemption Fund

title: Boat clubs in central Travancore shift to race mode ahead of season
content: Four teams from Kottayam and Pathanamthitta districts will compete in Nehru Trophy Boat Race. Several clubs, however, are keeping off races citing huge financial constraints

title: Andhra Pradesh eases industrial norms, halves parking mandate to woo investors
content: State streamlines regulations by relaxing setbacks, removing minimum plot size limits, and encouraging vertical development to reduce compliance costs, expedite project clearances, and enhance MSME competitiveness

title: Bihar SIR: BJP accuses Opposition of attempting to create anarchy for political gain
content: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticised the Opposition for attacking the ECI without any evidence, and alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was using the ‚Äòlanguage of rival countries‚Äô

title: Vote theft: Chamaraja MLA for examining voters‚Äô list of the constituency¬†
content: Gowda says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has placed the issue of vote theft with evidence before the people of the country, and a complaint in this regard will also be given to the Election Commission

title: Minister reviews flood situation in Vijayapura, asks officers to take up relief measures

title: Collateral-free shrimp crop loan scheme launched in A.P.
content: Under the APGB‚ÄìAquaExchange agreement, ‚Çπ25 crore worth of collateral-free crop loans will be disbursed to around 100 shrimp farmers over the next 3 to 6 months

title: Take up work on delimitation of wards in urban local bodies as per 2011 census: Mandya DC
content: The tenure of municipalities of Maddur, Malavalli, and Pandavapura will end on October 23; K.R. Pet on October 31; Bellur Town Panchayat on November 4; Nagamangala and Srirangapatna municipalities on November 5 and 6 respectively; while the term of Mandya City Municipal Council will conclude on November 2

title: Bommai sees need for apolitical struggle to get Bedti-Varada river linking project launched

title: Pakistani intruder shot at, arrested by BSF troops along International Border in J&K's Kathua
content: The injured intruder was arrested and immediately shifted to a hospital for treatment, the officials said, adding his identity and the motive behind his abortive attempt to infiltrate into this side was matter of further investigation.
